column4: ok. lucid lynx... just downloaded an hplip driver for my printer which came as a .run file it has been associated with gedit (dont know why?) and when i open a terminal and type in the command to run the shell script (as instructed at the website) i get a "sh: Can't open hplip-3.10.2.run" response.
did you do 'sh hplip-3.10.2.run'
yes, that is the command that generated the "can't" response
are you in the right directory?
i.e. are you in the directory where the file is located
yes, they told me to put it in my desktop and then do a "cd desktop" before executing the command. so, yes my prompt defines me as in desktop
that is odd then
have you tried right-clicking, and making the file executable?
under the right-click menu, properties -> permissions tab -> check the box after Execute:
yes, I have. and, that's where I notice that the file has been associated with the program gedit. which doesn't seem liek what i would want if i want it to be an executable. but that's a guess.
if it is marked as executable then double-clicking should ask you if you want to execute it
it should say "do you want to run the file or view its contents"
ok that seems to have done the trick. just wouldn't let me do it from within terminal for some reason.
you'll want to run it in terminal
it doesnt let me
hmm
but, it seems to be working fine as a self-extracting doohickey
okay
ok, installation notes tell me to enable the universe/multiverse repositories... any clue on that?
go to Software Sources in the Ubuntu menu
and check to enable those repositories
most likely they should be enabled already
thank you.t hat is simpler than where i was heading (the ubuntu repositories page.. which gives me a terminal command that requires me to know the repository location....)
